TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content: [@Vanamonde](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/27914-vanamonde/) What is the story behind your avatar?

>

> 25 minutes ago, lapis said:
> 
> 
> [@Vanamonde](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/27914-vanamonde/) What is the story behind your avatar?
> 

[@Supernovy](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/29617-supernovy/) likes rhyming jokes and associated bananas with my name, and so made me that pic.

Bananamonde!

Why can’t I see this thread on mobile (multiple browsers)?

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed3247374953" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/184019-131-14x-15x-16x-17x-kerbal-joint-reinforcement-continued-v340-25-04-2019/&do=embed" style="height:225px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

> 
> 
> On 4/17/2019 at 9:24 PM, 5thHorseman said:
> 
> 
> How about a number that tells how many spoilers they nested? Then we know to just keep walking by.
> 

The problem is that Squad doesn't actually write the forum software; it's a third-party product, so the forum is pretty much limited to what Invision chooses to put in there.  So the answer to "hey, could we have a forum feature that does X" questions will usually be "sorry, no".

(Squad does have *<u>some</u>* leeway to turn the configurable knobs that the software vendor chose to put in there-- e.g. "who's a moderator" or "how many posts does a newbie need to make until they're out of the queue", that sort of thing.  But that's just tuning stuff, not implementing new features.)

I got some questions...

1. What determines if a post is taken down, especially if it is REALLY borderline ok?

2. What do you have to do to be physically IP-banned from the forums?

Yeah. ok.

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> What determines if a post is taken down, especially if it is REALLY borderline ok?
> 

How much of a problem it creates for the forum, and group discussion if it's marginal. 

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> What do you have to do to be physically IP-banned from the forums?
> 

IP banning is a blunt instrument. We've only done it a couple of times, in response to DOS attacks and such. Otherwise there's too much risk of affecting innocent parties.

how much times did you have to ban someone from the forums, only to find that they created a new account?

p.s. it has the word forum so it's related
